channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Skin Changes That Can Happen As You Get Older
item.description: As you get older, everything starts changing -- including your skin. Find out what to look for and how to handle skin-related issues.

item.title: How To Start A Successful Health Coaching Business (Yes, You Can!)
item.description: Start your journey helping people make life-changing health shifts.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Tongue-tie in babies
item.description: Up to 10% of newborns are born with ankyloglossia, a condition more commonly known as tongue-tie. The most common symptom for infants is difficulty with breastfeeding or bottlefeeding. The American Academy of Pediatrics is raising concerns about the increasing use of surgeries, using scissors or lasers, to treat infants with tongue-tie, when research suggests these surgical […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Tongue-tie in babies appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Dos and Don'ts When a Migraine Starts
No Lie, This Supplement Is Like The Fountain Of Youth For Your Skin
item.description: Do you do your skin care routine morning and night? Great. But there's more you can do. Here's how to approach skin aging from the inside out.

item.title: Mayo Clinic offers new innovative therapy to treat atrial fibrillation
item.description: ROCHESTER, Minn. — Cardiologists in Mayo Clinic's Heart Rhythm Clinic are using a new innovative energy source to safely and successfully treat a common type of heart arrhythmia. The therapy, called pulsed field ablation (PFA), has received Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approval and represents a significant milestone in treating atrial fibrillation (AFib). The irregular and […] The post Mayo Clinic offers new innovative therapy to treat atrial fibrillation appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: In A Financial Pinch? 7 Small Savings Tips That Add Up To Big Savings
item.description: Don’t dismiss the power of baby steps, especially when it comes to saving money. Small money moves can add up to big savings.

item.title: Health concerns with wildfire smoke
item.description: Canadian and California wildfires are generating a lot of smoke, which is causing air quality issues in some places. Dr. Jesse Bracamonte, a Mayo Clinic family medicine physician, warns, "Smoke, in general, can affect anyone's health, particularly if they're in areas where wildfires are occurring. It can cause anything from eye irritation to respiratory infection; […] The post Health concerns with wildfire smoke appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: A 7-Week Plan To Master Pull-Ups (& Why This Move Is A+ For Healthy Aging)
item.description: Pull-ups are way more than just a flex—they can actively boost longevity and health span.

item.title: Your wearable says your heart rate variability has changed. Now what?
item.description: Mayo Clinic Healthcare expert explains what it means – and what to do with the information LONDON — Wearables measure several aspects of health, and heart rate variability might be one of those. It may be surprising when your device informs you that your heart rate variability is high or low, but what does it […] The post Your wearable says your heart rate variability has changed. Now what? appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Are Creatine Supplements Bad For Your Kidneys? What's Fact vs. Fiction
Mayo Clinic Minute: How untreated hearing loss can result in a negative health spiral
item.description: Hearing loss often is thought of as a normal part of aging, but recent studies have shown untreated hearing loss can significantly affect overall health. In this Mayo Clinic Minute, Dr. Nicholas Deep, a Mayo Clinic otolaryngologist, explains how untreated hearing loss can affect cognitive, social and physical health. Watch: The Mayo Clinic Minute Journalists: […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: How untreated hearing loss can result in a negative health spiral appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .
